file_content.text: Ah, Master Jedi. Hope it's alright if I hunker down here--didn't want to crowd you.
This ship's pretty luxurious compared to ours. Protector evac vessels are built for speed and defense, not comfort.
This ship's seen more battles than most starfighters, I'm afraid.
We don't do comfort either.
Try fighting with five hundred refugees on board. Changes your strategy a bit, I can tell you.
Is your convoy following us? What are the other Protectors doing?
Where are your ships now?
Already ahead of us, getting set up on Sleheyron. We've got full Republic support there.
Speeding to Aphelion Six, fast as they can. We're going to need all our resources for this.
Prepping for Bothawui. Haven't been briefed yet, but I can tell this one's going to be big.
We've got a few groups on other planets, but most are following your ship's signature.
As soon as the Protectors are safe, you and your staff are leaving.
Don't expect to stay long.
For the record, I appreciate this. We don't deserve it, but the work surely does.
Command thought I was crazy, asking for civs instead of soldiers. Look at us now: over ten thousand lives saved without firing a shot.
A Jedi advocates peace. The Republic doesn't always listen.
I try to be a good example.
Soldiers are trained to kill. After a while, it becomes a habit.
Everyone calls you "captain." I'm guessing you were a soldier, too.
Is that experience talking?
Volunteered at eighteen. Saw more than one treaty get stomped on.
Most Jedi spend their time meditating. I prefer to take action.
I'm not your average Jedi.
Of course you do. You're young still, and this is your first war.
I've seen death. Friends, family, teachers. Men I laughed and ate and fought with through three tours.
When this war is over, a lot more of our boys will want to be Protectors, too.
Conferencing with a team on Balmorra. Can it wait?
But if anyone has to break that record, I'm glad it's you. I admire your order's ideals--wish our military was the same.
